title: Emily Atack breaks her silence on split from Rob Jowers
text:
She split from her film producer boyfriend Rob Jowers in September after six months of dating.

And Emily Atack, 29, has broken her silence about the split in an interview with OK! magazine as she said she had hoped he was her 'happy ending.'

She said: 'It's been a very, very tough time and it's still very raw. Luckily, I've got so many things happening in my life to distract me from the fact I'm incredibly sad.

'I used meds to get me out of bed and dry my tears': Emily Atack has broken her silence on her split from Rob Jowers and her battle with depression

'But I know the drill and I've got over boys before. Heartbreak gets harder to deal with as you get older as you pin your hopes on things. I so wanted this to be my happy ending.'

Emily is releasing a new book called Are We There Yet? in which she talks about her life so far.

And she's searingly honest about her battles with depression and admits to using alcohol and anti-depressants during her darkest moments - she is now medication free.

She said: 'I know the drill and I've got over boys before. Heartbreak gets harder to deal with as you get older as you pin your hopes on things. I so wanted this to be my happy ending'

She said: 'I used medication to get me out of bed in the morning during an incredibly tough time and to dry up my tears, but I'm not in that place anymore.'

Emily admitted to being on medication for three years on the advice of her doctor rather than her therapist.

She said she feels 'stronger now' and ready for what life throws at her but notes that often the people who seem most bubbly are battling the biggest internal struggles.

In the book, Emily discusses her own thoughts on the #MeToo movement, acknowledging that she's dismissed certain behaviours as 'banter' when actually they are 'bl**** inappropriate.'

All over: The couple split last month following a six-month romance after meeting on the night of the BRITs

She also admitted she blamed herself in the past for 'inviting that behaviour' because she is blonde and busty and plays sexy characters.

But she now realises she has 'finally found her voice.'

Last month, before Emily split from Rob, she confessed that her body clock is 'flirting with the idea' of marriage and babies, but noted it was 'early days' with Rob.

Speaking during an interview on Loose Women, the I'm A Celebrity star talked candidly about her plans for the future.

Emily said: 'Marriage and babies is definitely what I want to do, not for everyone, for Rob and I it is still early days.

'My body clock is still flirting with the idea and I see Holly Willoughby and want that, but now it's work and I like being free.'

She also recalled her first meeting with Rob at Jack Whitehall’s BRITs after-party earlier this year.

'I don’t remember meeting him as I was so drunk. I went up to him and said, "Who are you?" and he said, "Who are YOU?". He got me a drink and we’ve been together ever since!', she laughed.

Emily's book, Are We There Yet?' is published by Seven Dials and is slated for release on October 31.
